Package cetus.transforms

Class LoopInterchange

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.transforms.TransformPass
      • cetus.transforms.LoopInterchange
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParallelLoopSwap
    public class LoopInterchange
extends TransformPass
    Exchange loops if they are perfect nested loop.

      • rankByMaxInterchange

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rankByMaxInterchange​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rank,

      • ReusabilityAnalysis

        public java.util.List ReusabilityAnalysis​(Program OriginalProgram,
                                          Loop LoopNest,
                                          java.util.List<AssignmentExpression> LoopExprs,
                                          java.util.List<ArrayAccess> LoopArrays,
                                          java.util.LinkedList<Loop> LoopNestList)
        Reusability Test to determine the innermost loop in the nest for Max reusability. 1. Loop which accesses the least number of cache lines should be the innermost loop. 2. To find reusability score , for a loop: (a) Form Reference groups with array accesses (b) Array accesses can be of following types: - Accesses with loop carried or non-loop carried dependencies - Accesses with no loop dependencies - Loop invariant accesses * Refer to K.S. McKinley's paper - 'Optimizing for parallelism and locality' on how the ref groups are formed 3. Add the costs in terms of cache lines for each reference group - For an array access w.r.t. candidate innermost loop (a) The array access requires 'trip/Cache Line size' no. of cache lines if the loop index of the candidate innermost loop appears on the rightmost dimension of the access(row-major access) (b) The array access requires 1 cache line if it is loop invariant and (c) The array access requires 'trip' no. of cache lines if the loop index of the candidate innermost loop appears on the leftmost dimension of the access(Column-major access) *trip : Number of iterations of the candidate innermost loop. 4. Multiply the Reference group costs with the number of iterations of loops other than the candidate innnermost loop 5. Here Cache line size is assumed to be 64. 6.Symbolic loop bounds are also supported, though extensive testing needs to be done to ensure accuracy.
        Parameters:
        OriginalProgram - - The program
        LoopNest - - The loop nest to be analyzed
        LoopExprs - - The expressions in the loop body
        LoopArrays - - All array accesses in the loop body
        LoopNestList - - List of loops in the loop nest
        Returns:
        - - Order of the loops in the nest for max reusability

      • LoopCost

        protected long LoopCost​(java.util.ArrayList ReferenceCosts,
                        java.util.HashMap LoopNestIterCount,
                        Expression CurrentLoop)
        Determines the cost in terms of cache lines for the loop. Add the costs of all the reference groups and multiply with the iteration count of the loops other than the candidate innermost loop.
        Parameters:
        ReferenceCosts - - Cost of Ref groups
        LoopNestIterCount - - Number of iterations of each loop in the nest
        CurrentLoop - - Loop index of current loop
        Returns:
        - Loop cost in terms of cache lines accessed

      • SymbolicLoopCost

        protected Expression SymbolicLoopCost​(java.util.ArrayList ReferenceCosts,
                                      java.util.HashMap LoopNestIterCount,
                                      Expression CurrentLoop)
        Symbolic loop cost. Same as the routine to calculate loop cost with long loop bounds.

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal​(java.util.LinkedList<Loop> nest,
                       int src,
                       int target)
        Check legality of loop interchange between src and target. Both src and target are in the nest and src is outer than target
        Parameters:
        nest - - The input loop nest
        src - - Rank of the source loop
        target - - Rank of the target loop
        Returns:
        - If two loops can be interchanged or not
